Articles.Content: Used a real texture this time, and modeling was easier. I also made the background larger and rendered with 400 samples. I'm quite happy with it.

Hey! That's the brand TV my kerbals use! (however the logo is wrong)

see?

Whoops!! I had no idea....I thought I had an original idea happening!

I hope its okay if I use that...I didn't know it was taken!

Hey, by the way, does anyone know how to actually play a movie clip, ie .mp4, in blender? I want to actually render a short clip of the television set, with a clip actually playing on it. I'm using the cycles render engine..so far, I haven't found anything useful on how to do this. Do any of you guys know how?

Again...some great work happening here! Wow!

Universe

Well, seeing as I shot down your Creativity. Here's a tutorial on how to do that (that i made for you)

Make sure you watch with annotations on. because that's how I show you what's what.

and yes, my mousewheel can still register middle clicks, just not scrolling (making it a pain in the rectum to work in blender)

EDIT: and yes, you can use the Kerb-vision brand TV.

Wow! That was really nice of you! I really appreciate that!

Thanks a lot!

Universe

now to begin......

Great stuff, Universe. The hair could still use some work, but I tried out applying hair myself and I know it's pretty hard, so I guess it's good for now. It really looks like a kerbal enjoying a good football game to me. Keep up the good work!

http://i.imgur.com/CFYS3J6.png

That's creepy but cool. Kinda looks like a shark.

Just putting this here because I'm bored. I'm working on a Minecraft movie, if you didn't know that already. Finally got a proper IK Target rig on the darn thing... now for the shape key driver bones. Lovely.

EDIT

A few minutes of deleting and adding blurs and:

Presto, Herobrine.

Here's another one. This time I used copy-paste for the first time.

I also put both cups on a diorama-like structure, with a vertical plane with an emissive texture on the left, and a black one on the right, so the bright side would look brighter.

What do you guys think about it? Any suggestions?

Awesome. What material is that?

I don't use blender, and it's a shader specific material, so it's really not going to be relevant. but the name of the material is "paint metallic jet black"
here goes something that could be in the game. It's a 5 way stack coupler, that can double as landing legs.

welcome to the future. unmanned space plane command pod with built in air intake. this could actually be used in game. it's a little high on the poly count, but since you'll probably only use one on a vessel, it's not really all that detrimental.

So, I don't suppose I could cajole somebody more experienced with rigging in Blender than I to take a look at why, when I try to rig my kerbal model, a portion of its "chest" doesn't seem to latch onto the rig? >_>

Oh, if you have the armatures set to the object already, go into weight paint mode to add in the area that's not moving to that bone.

so in short.

Select the mesh

hit [sHIFT]+[TAB]

Set the brush type to "add"

select the bone that you want to move that section of mesh

Paint in the verts you want to move.

Just something I cooked up out of thin air. Comes in at a modest 300 faces, full geometry detail. I'd say it could either be ion or a series of mini aerospike jets.

I could probably make this backing into an intake, then there'd be no need for an independent intake.

Edited March 1, 2014 by trekkie_

"300 faces" holds no meaning in my books.

How about this?

Just cause, you know, everything needs 30k verts.

[Dragon model]

Oh, I just noticed. How the heck do I have more faces than verts?!

Points: 346

Edges: 673

Faces: 329

not really a big deal.

I think face measurements matter more when you're talking about quads, than triangles, since multiple triangles can fill the area of a single surface and create an unneeded amount of vertices/faces.

Edited March 4, 2014 by trekkie_
